title: Theresa May statement after MPs trigger vote of no confidence - Cornwall Live
text:
Theresa May statement after MPs trigger vote of no confidence
The Prime Minister is making a statement outside 10 Downing Street this morning Share Neil Shaw Head of Digital, live and trending for PlymouthLive, DevonLive and CornwallLive Updated News Prime Minister Theresa May (Image: Jonathan Brady/PA Wire)
Prime Minister Theresa May is expected to make a statement outside 10 Downing Street this morning after her MPs triggered a vote of no confidence in her leadership.
A ballot is to be held this evening which, if Mrs May doesn't get the backing of half of her party, will mean a formal leadership election.
Mrs May would not be able to stand to be re-elected as leader, meaning the Conservative Party would have a new head, and the country a new Prime Minister.
The move comes after 48 MPs called on the Conservatives' ruling 1922 committee to trigger a vote of no confidence in the wake of Mrs May's withdrawal plan from the EU.
Committee chairman Sir Graham Brady said: "In accordance with the rules, a ballot will be held between 1800 and 2000 on Wednesday 12th December in committee room 14 of the House of Commons. The votes will be counted immediately afterwards and an announcement will be made as soon as possible in the evening. Arrangements for the announcement will be released later today." 08:52 PM says she will contest the vote
“I stand ready to finish the job” 08:51 A new leader would have to delay or stop Brexit, says PM 08:50 Theresa May has taken to the podium
She says she has met with EU leaders in recent days, but will now focus on the leadership challenge 08:50
